channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024060933
item.description:
Report X-2024060933

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: KINGSTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO DRY ICE VAPOR OMITTING FROM THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 10 POUNDS OF UNDECLARED DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 35E0Y1, LANDSMAN MEAT CO LLC, 1666 ROUTE 9W, MILTON NY 12547-5430.

item.title: Report E-2024060040
item.description:
Report E-2024060040

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 29, 2024, one (1) 55-pound bag of UN2680 was torn during loading and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Republic Services (RS) to remediate the impacted site. RS personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the lithium hydroxide-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060192
item.description:
Report E-2024060192

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-18
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When loading a pallet of pails into a trailer the forklift operator stuck the forkblades into the pallet the pails were staged on and while doing so the forkblades were slightly tilted back causing one of the blades to go through the wooden slats of the pallet consequently slightly puncturing a pail contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.

item.title: Report E-2024060004
item.description:
Report E-2024060004

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNW experienced a UN2222 Rhodiasolv MPE XP release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to an 8’ x 12’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While Unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a box that was slightly leaking. Further investigation revealed that the box looks like it had been hit by a forkblade consequently puncturing the box contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the damaged box.
